title: Italics: What characters stay "roman"?
content:
Dear forum members,

I’m working on my first italic font face\*, so there is a lot to explore for me in there yet. Are there any tips, guides, books, etc. that talk about italics specifically?  
Also, are there special things to consider for swash characters? Are there only uppercase ones usually, or also lc?  
Every annotation is useful for me…

Specific question at the moment: What characters stay upright even in an italic version of a font? I’ve read about it somewhere (can’t remember where and when), and I’ve already seen typefaces, that have no italic mathematical operators. Are there more characters that stay in their roman form?

Thanks for your help  
sebilar

\* an italic version of [this one](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329213657/http:/typophile.com/node/17136).
author: sebilar

comments.content:
_Also, are there special things to consider for swash characters? Are there only uppercase ones usually, or also lc?_

there usually are swash characters for as many lettters (uppercase or lowercase) as the designer wants to creat variants for.
